detaileddescription.para: WB means write-back and intends to transfer dirty cache lines to memory in a copy-back cache policy. May be a no-op in write-back cache policy.
INVD means invalidate and will mark cache lines as not valid. A future access to the associated address is guaranteed to generate a memory fetch.
The API is provided to get the d-cache line size.

simplesect.para: size of the d-cache line or 0 if the d-cache is not enabled.
